We sink into the dust, a silent, slow descent,
The vibrant tapestry of life, to elemental sent.
Our transient forms dissolving, like castles made of sand,
Returning to the substance, of this ancient, patient land.

The echoes of our laughter, the tears we once let fall,
Are mingled with the particles, responding to earth's call.
The monuments we fashioned, with grand and lofty aim,
Become but gentle hillocks, whispering our name.

But dust is not oblivion, nor ending dark and cold,
It holds the seeds of futures, stories yet untold.
From broken shards of pottery, new vessels take their form,
Emerging from the ruins, weathering every storm.

We sink into the dust, a cycle ever true,
To rise again in blossoms, bathed in morning dew.
A part of endless motion, a spirit wild and free,
Connected to the cosmos, for all eternity.
